intro: Solanum edinense subsp. salamanii, commonly known as the Edinburgh nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the Scottish Highlands. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually white or pale purple, which bloom in late summer. Its berries are dark blue to black when ripe and contain toxic compounds, making them harmful to humans and animals. This subspecies is notable for its ecological role in supporting local insect populations.
